intro: Delarbrea spectabilis, commonly known as the showy delarbrea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
